title: Israel Says Cease-Fire Is in Effect in Gaza
summary: The statement came after Israel approved a deal between Israel and Hamas to pave the way for the release of hostages in exchange for Palestinian prisoners.

title: Aid Groups Prepare to Provide Quick Relief to Gaza Under Cease-Fire
summary: The new Israel-Hamas deal contains provisions to increase aid to Gaza, and for the reopening of a border crossing from Egypt.

title: U.S. to Send 200 Troops to Israel in Support Roles
summary: The American force will help coordinate the many aspects of the cease-fire deal.

title: How Jared Kushner, a Self-Described ‘Deal Guy,’ Helped Broker a Gaza Breakthrough
summary: Trained in New York City real estate, the president’s son-in-law had a single goal: Get to a yes first, and hash out the details later. “It’s just different being deal guys — just a different sport,” he said.

title: Trump’s Retribution Lands on Latest Target, and U.S. Troops Head to Israel
summary: Plus, your Friday news quiz.

title: James Indictment Mirrors Her Civil Case Against Trump in Miniature
summary: The president and New York’s attorney general accused each other of real estate fraud. But the sum involved in her case is $18,933, while millions were at stake in his.

title: How Letitia James, Now Indicted, Will Stay as New York’s Attorney General
summary: New York state’s chief legal officer, now a criminal defendant, runs an 800-lawyer agency that is at the center of state government.

title: Who Is María Corina Machado, the Winner of the 2025 Nobel Peace Prize?
summary: Ms. Machado built one of Venezuela’s most important political movements, and lives in hiding from President Nicolás Maduro’s authoritarian government.

title: Meet the Woman Leading Venezuela’s Opposition to Maduro
summary: Spurned by the country’s authoritarian president and even her own colleagues in the opposition, María Corina Machado has built the most significant voter mobilization since Hugo Chávez.

title: How Right-Wing Influencers Are Shaping the Guard Fight in Portland
summary: President Trump and his administration are amplifying the voices of pro-White House podcasters and streamers eager to ratify the president’s description of Oregon’s largest city as a “hellscape.”

title: What a National Guard Deployment Means
summary: John Ismay, who reports on the Pentagon for The New York Times, describes what National Guard troops and civilian law enforcement are doing in cities where President Trump has mobilized them.

title: Federal Judge Temporarily Blocks Trump’s National Guard Deployment in Chicago Area
summary: Judge April M. Perry said the Trump administration had not established that sending in troops over the governor’s objection was legally justified. An appeal is likely.

title: What Courts Have Said in Challenges to Trump’s National Guard Deployments
summary: Federal courts across the country have heard legal challenges to the mobilization of troops in Los Angeles, Washington, Portland, Ore., and Chicago. Here’s how some judges have ruled.

title: Glenn Close on ‘Sunset Boulevard,’ ‘Fatal Attraction’ and Her Storied Career
summary: For half a century, she’s brought her singular talents to the stage and screen. Now, the actress wants one more shot at the role that helped make her a star.

title: Venezuela’s Maduro Offered the U.S. His Nation’s Riches to Avoid Conflict
summary: Venezuela’s autocrat had proposed allocating his country’s oil wealth and other natural resources to the U.S. and ending deals with American adversaries to appease President Trump.

title: Iran Lures Transgender Foreigners for Surgery but Forces Operations on Locals
summary: Iran became a pioneer in gender transition operations by forcing procedures on L.G.B.T.Q. Iranians. Desperate for cash, the Islamic republic is hoping to attract trans patients from around the world.

title: Why China Built 162 Square Miles of Solar Panels on the World’s Highest Plateau
summary: China is using the high-altitude expanse for immense solar panel farms and wind turbines and has begun work on the world’s largest hydroelectric dams.

title: Inside Hegseth’s Effort to Limit Press Access at the Pentagon
summary: Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth is at odds with the news media to a degree unseen in modern times, former Pentagon officials say.

title: Senate Passes Bipartisan $925 Billion Defense Policy Bill
summary: The legislation would provide a 3.8 percent pay raise for American troops, while funding weapons and overhauling military procurement.

title: France’s Domestic Instability Has Weakened Its Diplomatic Clout
summary: President Emmanuel Macron’s inability to find a government that can pass a new budget is hobbling his efforts to influence Europe’s agenda.

title: Sister Jean, Loyola Basketball Superfan and Team Chaplain, Dies at 106
summary: She led the Ramblers’ players in pregame prayers, pointed out opponents’ strengths and weaknesses and supported the team in N.C.A.A. tournaments.

title: Curious Reindeer and Charging Polar Bears: The Changing Wildlife at the Top of the Earth
summary: Climate change is transforming ecosystems in the far north. An international team of scientists has made some surprising discoveries.

title: How Kai Cenat Became a New Kind of Celebrity for Gen Z
summary: With his boisterous antics, Cenat has gained 19 million Twitch followers and the attention of celebrities who covet that audience.

title: Give Trump the Nobel for Gaza, if He Does the Harder Parts to Come
summary: It’s a job that will take the rest of his presidency.

title: The A.I. Prompt That Could End the World
summary: A destructive A.I., like a nuclear bomb, is now a concrete possibility; the question is whether anyone will be reckless enough to build one.

title: Peru Ousts President Amid Crime Surge
summary: Growing outrage over crime and political scandals eroded support for President Dina Boluarte, the country’s most unpopular leader in recent history.

title: Judge Rejects ‘Unprecedented’ Indictment Amid Trump’s D.C. Clampdown
summary: The federal magistrate judge, Zia M. Faruqui, accused prosecutors of relying on a “facially invalid” indictment to charge a man with felony gun possession.

title: Mexico’s President Is Popular. So Is Her Professional Lookalike.
summary: Claudia Sheinbaum, Mexico’s first woman president, has recent approval ratings as high as 79 percent. An actress with a startling resemblance, Tamara Henaine, is taking advantage of the moment.

title: Bats Catch Migratory Birds and Eat Them in Midair
summary: For the first time, scientists documented direct evidence of a bat preying on a bird at high altitude.
